Home → New suggestions → Articles → Get ready for Latitude 2018 with Freegal

Get ready for Latitude 2018 with Freegal

Written by Lisa Brennan · Published Jul 4, 2018

This year’s Latitude music festival takes place in Southwold from 12-15 July. Why not stream or download some of the songs you’re likely to hear there?

Set up Freegal →

Solange - A Seat at the Table

Friday headliner Solange’s third album is a highly personal exploration of black culture and social history, with messages of “identity, empowerment, independence, grief and healing”. Track 4, Cranes in the Sky, won a Grammy for Best R&B Performance.

The Vaccines - Combat Sports

The Vaccines are on top form for their euphoric fourth album.

Rag’n’Bone Man - Human

If you aren’t one of the 750,000+ people who already own this album, you can stream it for free or download five tracks a week with your library card.

The Charlatans - Who We Touch

The 11th of the alternative rock band’s 13 albums was released in 2010. Their most recent albums, Different Days is available to borrow on CD.

Gang of Youths - Go Farther in Lightness

The Sydney rock band’s award-winning second album “poetically explores the human experience in all its bleakness and triumph, confusion and clarity, heartbreak and joyousness” (James Clements, Rolling Stone Australia).

Bomba Estéreo - Ayo

The ‘electro tropical’ band’s fifth album combines traditional Colombian instrumentation, dance and reggae, and their songs are bound to enthuse the crowd with their positive and inclusive messages.

Sleeper - Greatest Hits

The Britpop favourites have reformed for a tour after a 20-year break, and plan to release new material next year. In the meantime, you can download or stream classic tracks including Inbetweener, What Do I Do Now? and Sale of the Century.

Lisa Brennan

I'm a content and reader development librarian.
